intro: Eriocaulon tenuissimum, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a small herbaceous plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and dense, spike-like inflorescences. Native to wetlands and marshy areas, it thrives in moist, nutrient-poor soils. The plant produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers that are typically clustered in dense spikes. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and semi-aquatic ecosystems.
